text: The 1935 Winnipeg Winnipegs finished in 1st place in the Manitoba Rugby Football Union with a 3–0 division record. The Winnipegs became the first Western Canada team to win the Grey Cup, with a victory over the Hamilton Tigers. ==Exhibition games== {| class="wikitable sortable" ! style="background:#0A0A85;color:#FCC200;" width="8%"| Date ! style="background:#0A0A85;color:#FCC200;" width="20%"| Opponent ! style="background:#0A0A85;color:#FCC200;" width="10%"| Score ! style="background:#0A0A85;color:#FCC200;" width="10%"| Result ! style="background:#0A0A85;color:#FCC200;" width="10%"| Record |-align="center" bgcolor="#ddffdd" | Sept 14 | at Concordia Cobbers | 26–0https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=OHlTAAAAIBAJ&sjid;=OTgNAAAAIBAJ&pg;=2314%2C1426498 The Leader-Post – Sep 16, 1935 | Win | 1–0 |-align="center" bgcolor="#ddffdd" | Sept 21 | vs. Sarnia Imperials | 3–1https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=PXlTAAAAIBAJ&sjid;=OTgNAAAAIBAJ&pg;=2200%2C2210876 The Leader-Post – Sep 23, 1935 | Win | 2–0 |-align="center" bgcolor="#ddffdd" | Sept 28 | at Minnesota All-Stars | 21–13https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=Q3lTAAAAIBAJ&sjid;=OTgNAAAAIBAJ&pg;=6214%2C3029569 The Leader-Post – Sep 30, 1935 | Win | 3–0 |-align="center" bgcolor="#ddffdd" | Oct 24 | vs. University of North Dakota Sioux | 23-7 | Win | 4-0 |-align="center" bgcolor="#ddffdd" | Dec 2 | at Assumption College | 17-0 | Win | 5–0 |} ==Regular season== ===Standings=== {| class="wikitable" |+ Manitoba Rugby Football Union !
